title: 114_hr6248
content: The "Spending Safeguard Act" may be cited as the short title. It includes a spending limitation on direct spending programs. The Spending Safeguard Act establishes spending limitations for direct spending programs, determined by the Director of the Office of Management and Budget. The limitation is set at 120% or 110% of the program cost, depending on the budget function category. The Spending Safeguard Act sets spending limitations for direct spending programs at 120% or 110% of the program cost, determined by the Director of the Office of Management and Budget using scorecards or estimates under the Statutory Pay-As-You-Go Act of 2010. The Director maintains a spending safeguard limitation scorecard for public access, displaying spending levels for operational direct spending programs on a monthly basis. The Spending Safeguard Act requires the Secretary of the Treasury to report monthly spending levels for direct spending programs subject to limitations. The Director must submit biannual reports to Congress on total spending and compliance with spending limits. Additionally, the President's budget submissions must include a report on total spending levels for all programs. The Spending Safeguard Act mandates reporting of spending levels for direct spending programs subject to limitations. The President's budget submissions must include total spending levels for all programs, and procedures are outlined in case of breaching spending limitations. The Spending Safeguard Act requires reporting on spending levels for direct spending programs. If a program is projected to breach its spending limit within six months, a report must be sent to the relevant committees. If a program has already breached its limit, funds cannot be obligated for the program and a report must be submitted to the committees. The Spending Safeguard Act imposes limitations on funds for programs projected to breach spending limits. Agencies must inform participants of potential impacts on future funding availability. Definitions include the Director of the Office of Management and Budget and direct spending as per the Balanced Budget and Emergency Deficit Control Act. The Act defines key terms such as "Director" and "direct spending program" and prohibits new funding authorization.
